lines.text: [Stallings wants Mike to postpone his vacation to hunt for his missing stepdaughter, giving him a hefty check as an inducement]
The nerve of some people. They can't take no for an answer.
Well, you don't want to be too hard on Stallings, dear. You'd be desperate, too, if a member of your family were missing.
[shows Phyllis the check]
Look - isn't it pretty?
Where's your suitcase, darling? Our taxi's waiting.
Oh, ah, well, you know after you left, I got to thinking...
And you decided to postpone our vacation.
Well, no, not exactly. Well, as a matter of fact, after you left I did a little telephoning. I got a lead. Angel, I can find that missing girl inside of 48 hours.
Fine, I'll stay and help you.
Angel, I said I could find her in 48 hours. That's without you - with you, it's indefinite.
I thought you and Mike had buried the hatchet.
I'd like to bury the hatchet right in his thick skull!
Well, come right in, gentlemen. You, too, Rafferty.
[Mike sends Tim to rent a large car to transport an inconvenient corpse away from his office]
I don't know why the guy picks on me. There are so many good guys to get for this job. There's Frankenstein, Dracula, the Wolfman...
What are you here for, business or pleasure?
Both! It will be a pleasure to give you the business!
[last lines]
[a burly attendant knocks Mike out]
I'm sorry, lady, but he had it coming to him.
Oh, much obliged. It's the only way I could get him to go on a vacation.
What's on your mind, Tim?
Oh, nothing much. Just lookin' for news.
15 last night.
That's fine. How do you expect us to sell newspapers?
